CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1952, pg. 27, reads: "Hail the Champ! - Joseph Parker, center who was crowned marble champ for the city of Pittsburgh last week, shows the form that enabled him to walk off with the title. On the left is Melvin Lewis, runner-up in tournament.  Stephen Bodnar, director of Manchester Recreation Center and the man who helped get the boys in championship form, is on the right. The tournament was directed by Gimbels and the Bureau of Recreation.  Parker will compete for the national title at a later date. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of 1952 city of Pittsburgh marbles champ Joseph Parker wearing crown in center, runner-up Melvin Lewis on left, and director of Manchester Recreation Center Stephan Bodnar on right
